{{Infobox CFL player |name=Pierre Desjardins |full_name= |image= |ImageWidth= |caption=1971 Topps CFL Card of Montreal Alouettes offensive lineman Pierre Desjardins |status=Retired |import=no |position1=Guard |position2=Offensive tackle |birth_date={{Birth date and age|mf=yes|1941|10|28}} |birth_place=[[Montreal]], [[Quebec]] |College=[[University of Wyoming]] |high_school= |Height_ft= |Height_in= |Weight_lbs= |CFLDraftedYear= |CFLDraftedRound= |CFLDraftedPick= |CFLDraftedTeam= |playing_years=1966â1971 |playing_teams=[[Montreal Alouettes]] |career_highlights= |CFLAllStar= |Awards= |Honours= |Records= }} '''Pierre Desjardins''' (born October 28, 1941) is a former professional [[Canadian football]] player with the [[Canadian Football League]] [[Montreal Alouettes]]. Desjardins was an [[Lineman (football)|offensive lineman]] at the [[Guard (American football)|guard]] and [[Offensive tackle|tackle]] positions during his six year career (1966-1971) with the club. Desjardins' jersey #63 is one of seven [[Montreal Alouettes#Retired numbers|retired]] by the Alouettes.<ref name="Pringle's No. 27 retired by Als">{{cite web | url = http://www.cbc.ca/sports/story/2005/06/22/pringle050622.html| accessdate = 2007-05-09 | author = | title = Pringle's No. 27 retired by Als | publisher = CBC.ca | date = 2005-07-02}}</ref>
Desjardins is currently a [[Canada|Canadian]] businessman, previously serving on the [[board of directors]] for Canadian businesses such as [[Domtar]], [[Labatt|Labatt Brewing Company]], and [[Imperial Tobacco]].<ref name="The Future Is Not What It Was (Introduction)">{{cite web | url = http://www.empireclubfoundation.com/details.asp?SpeechID=2111&FT=yes | accessdate = 2007-05-09 | author = Jackman, Dr. Frederic | title = The Future Is Not What It Was (Introduction) | publisher = The Empire Club | date = 1994-01-13}}</ref>
== College career == Desjardins was born and raised in [[Montreal]], and played [[Football Canada|amateur Canadian football]] for the [[Quebec Junior Football League]] Rosemont Bombers.<ref name="Notable Graduates">{{cite web | url = http://www.qjfl.ca/english/graduates.html | accessdate = 2007-05-09 | author = | title = Notable Graduates | publisher = Quebec Junior Football League (QJFL.ca) | date = }}</ref> He played [[college football|collegiately]] at the [[University of Wyoming]] prior to joining the [[Montreal Alouettes|Als]].<ref name="The Future Is Not What It Was (Introduction)">{{cite web | url = http://www.empireclubfoundation.com/details.asp?SpeechID=2111&FT=yes | accessdate = 2007-05-09 | author = Jackman, Dr. Frederic | title = The Future Is Not What It Was (Introduction) | publisher = The Empire Club | date = 1994-01-13}}</ref>
== Professional football career == Following his graduation from [[University of Wyoming|Wyoming]], where he earned a [[Bachelor of Business Science|business degree]], Desjardins returned to Montreal and began his professional career with the [[Canadian Football League|CFL]] [[Montreal Alouettes|Alouettes]] in [[1966 CFL season|1966]].<ref name="The Future Is Not What It Was (Introduction)">{{cite web | url = http://www.empireclubfoundation.com/details.asp?SpeechID=2111&FT=yes | accessdate = 2007-05-09 | author = Jackman, Dr. Frederic | title = The Future Is Not What It Was (Introduction) | publisher = The Empire Club | date = 1994-01-13}}</ref> Desjardins was an [[Lineman (football)|offensive lineman]] at the [[Guard (American football)|guard]] and [[Offensive tackle|tackle]] positions during his six year career ([[1966 CFL season|1966]]-[[1971 CFL season|1971]]) with the Als, helping to protect Alouettes [[quarterback]] [[Sonny Wade]] for the majority of his career with the club.
Desjardins, as co-captain of the team (along with co-captain, [[Larry Fairholm]]), helped turn around a then-mediocre Alouettes team, eventually reaching and winning the [[58th Grey Cup|Grey Cup in 1970]]. Desjardins retired following the Alouettes' [[1971 CFL season]].
== Post-football career == Following his playing days, Desjardins was a [[sportscaster]] with the [[Canadian Broadcasting Corporation]]. He also served as an executive with Canadian companies such as [[Domtar]], [[Labatt|Labatt Brewing Company]], and [[Imperial Tobacco]].<ref name="The Future Is Not What It Was (Introduction)">{{cite web | url = http://www.empireclubfoundation.com/details.asp?SpeechID=2111&FT=yes | accessdate = 2007-05-09 | author = Jackman, Dr. Frederic | title = The Future Is Not What It Was (Introduction) | publisher = The Empire Club | date = 1994-01-13}}</ref>
